t: Isaiah 40
God’s People Are Comforted
“Comfort,*pn yes, comfort My people!” Says*ld your God.
“Speak*ld comfort to Jerusalem, and cry out to her, That*ld her warfare is ended, That*ld her iniquity is pardoned; For*ld she has received from the Lord’s*s hand Double*ld for all her sins.”
The*ln voice of one crying in the wilderness: “Prepare*ld the way of the Lord;*s Make*ld straight in the desert A*ld highway for our God.
Every*ld valley shall be exalted And*ld every mountain and hill brought low; The*ld crooked places shall be made straight And*ld the rough places smooth;
The*ld glory of the Lord*s shall be revealed, And*ld all flesh shall see it*i together; For*ld the mouth of the Lord*s has spoken.”
The*ln voice said, “Cry out!” And*ld he said, “What shall I cry?” “All*ln flesh is*i grass, And*ld all its loveliness is*i like the flower of the field.
The*ld grass withers, the flower fades, Because*ld the breath of the Lord*s blows upon it; Surely*ld the people are*i grass.
The*ld grass withers, the flower fades, But*ld the word of our God stands forever.”

O*ln Zion, You*ld who bring good tidings, Get*ld up into the high mountain; O*ld Jerusalem, You*ld who bring good tidings, Lift*ld up your voice with strength, Lift*ld it*i up, be not afraid; Say*ld to the cities of Judah, “Behold your God!”
Behold,*ln the Lord God*s shall come with a strong hand,*i And*ld His arm shall rule for Him; Behold,*ld His reward is*i with Him, And*ld His work before Him.
He*ld will feed His flock like a shepherd; He*ld will gather the lambs with His arm, And*ld carry them*i in His bosom, And*ild gently lead those who are with young.

Who*ln has measured the waters in the hollow of His hand, Measured*ld heaven with a span And*ld calculated the dust of the earth in a measure? Weighed*ld the mountains in scales And*ld the hills in a balance?
Who*ld has directed the Spirit of the Lord,*s Or*ld as*i His counselor has taught Him?
With*ld whom did He take counsel, and who*i instructed Him, And*ld taught Him in the path of justice? Who*ld taught Him knowledge, And*ld showed Him the way of understanding?
Behold,*ln the nations are*i as a drop in a bucket, And*ld are counted as the small dust on the scales; Look,*ld He lifts up the isles as a very little thing.
And*ld Lebanon is*i not sufficient to burn, Nor*ld its beasts sufficient for a burnt offering.
All*ld nations before Him are*i as nothing, And*ld they are counted by Him less than nothing and worthless.
To*ln whom then will you liken God? Or*ld what likeness will you compare to Him?
The*ld workman molds an image, The*ld goldsmith overspreads it with gold, And*ld the silversmith casts silver chains.
Whoever*ld is*i too impoverished for such*i a contribution Chooses*ld a tree that*i will not rot; He*ld seeks for himself a skillful workman To*ld prepare a carved image that*i will not totter.
Have*ln you not known? Have*ld you not heard? Has*ld it not been told you from the beginning? Have*ld you not understood from the foundations of the earth?

It*ild is*i He who sits above the circle of the earth, And*ld its inhabitants are*i like grasshoppers, Who*ld stretches out the heavens like a curtain, And*ld spreads them out like a tent to dwell in.
He*ld brings the princes to nothing; He*ld makes the judges of the earth useless.

Scarcely*ln shall they be planted, Scarcely*ld shall they be sown, Scarcely*ld shall their stock take root in the earth, When*ld He will also blow on them, And*ld they will wither, And*ld the whirlwind will take them away like stubble.
“To*ln whom then will you liken Me, Or*ld to*i whom*i shall I be equal?” says the Holy One.

Lift*ld up your eyes on high, And*ld see who has created these things,*i Who*ld brings out their host by number; He*ld calls them all by name, By*ld the greatness of His might And*ld the strength of His*i power; Not*ld one is missing.
Why*ln do you say, O Jacob, And*ld speak, O Israel: “My*ld way is hidden from the Lord,*s And*ld my just claim is passed over by my God”?
Have*ld you not known? Have*ld you not heard? The*ld everlasting God, the Lord,*s The*ld Creator of the ends of the earth, Neither*ld faints nor is weary. His*ld understanding is unsearchable.
He*ld gives power to the weak, And*ld to those*i who*i have*i no might He increases strength.
Even*ld the youths shall faint and be weary, And*ld the young men shall utterly fall,
But*ld those who wait on the Lord*s Shall*ld renew their*i strength; They*ld shall mount up with wings like eagles, They*ld shall run and not be weary, They*ld shall walk and not faint.
